DataElement.preferredName: Linear Analogue Self-Assessment Past Week Level of Support from Friends and Family Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of the level of support from their friends and family during the past week, using an eleven point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Linear Analogue Self-Assessment Past Week Level of Support from Friends and Family Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy._The most recent week, including today._A question about an individual's level of support from their friends and family._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy.

Concepts.definition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Level of Support from Friends and Family Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about an individual's level of support from their friends and family.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Level of Support from Friends and Family
Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's level of support from their friends and family.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools
